issue_description:
# Modals at the edge of the display view get cropped

**Describe the bug**
When a warning icon is at the edge of the browser window the modal that is shown when the mouse pointer is on the icon can be partially out of view.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
 1. Create an exploration with a solution that is actually not a solution (the solution answer is not correct)
 2. Make the browser window less wide
 3. Point over the warning icon

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10142938/65376718-a8b93200-dca3-11e9-915a-85574c40c923.png)

**Possible Steps to fix this issue**
1. Go to `core/templates/components/state-editor/state-solution-editor/state-solution-editor.component.html`
2. Find the `oppia-rule-header-warning-placement` class.
3. Change the placement of the tooltip (currently set to `bottom`) according to the screen size.

**Desktop (please complete the following information; delete this section if the issue does not arise on desktop):**
 - OS: Ubuntu
 - Browser: Firefox
 - Version: 69

issue_comments.body: Probably not a blocking issue, but marking as a triage to be sure.
Hmmm, nice catch! I wouldn't personally consider this blocking, but we should fix this (and possibly other instances of this).
Hi! Can I get this issue assigned to me? I want to work on it please!
@smml1996 Assigned you...
Hi @oppia/core-maintainers, this issue is not assigned to any project. Can you please update the same? Thanks!
Hi @kevintab95  and @gp201, is this issue still open?
@siddharthmehta02 Can you please check if this bug is still present by attempting to reproduce it?
no it is not present
@harshit973 Can you please provide a screenshot of how it looks now?
I am still able to reproduce this on smaller screens.
Is anyone working on this? Can I assign it to me?

Hi @karenbanci, go for it! In general feel free to assign yourself to anything that's not being worked on. For LaCE, we generally recommend choosing from the first tab in [this list](https://github.com/orgs/oppia/projects/3) where possible. Thanks!
@seanlip Thank you =)
@seanlip I opened this discussion, I'm having problems importing files  : https://github.com/oppia/oppia/discussions/16482
I cannot reproduce these errors in my browser. Python version 3.8.12 Chrome: Version 107.0.5304.87 (Official Build) (arm64) Seems to have been fixed here: https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/11697

@vojtechjelinek Hi, Could you tell me if it was solved?
I tried to reproduce the error and nothing comes up to fix.

@karenbanci You will need to look for an exploration that contains a warning. See number one in the description "Create an exploration with a solution that is actually not a solution (the solution answer is not correct)".

IMAGE
before:
![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63313366/221121311-2403bb3a-06ae-416b-9f41-fa74c2242c07.png)
after:
![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63313366/221121348-5a0ead42-09c4-4e50-91e2-cbdeb7fc8089.png)

CODE
before:
```
<div class="oppia-rule-header-warning-placement"
                   *ngIf="!isSolutionValid()"
                   (click)="toggleInlineSolutionEditorIsActive()"
                   [ngbTooltip]="getInvalidSolutionTooltip()"
                   placement="bottom">
```
after:
```
<div class="oppia-rule-header-warning-placement"
                   *ngIf="!isSolutionValid()"
                   (click)="toggleInlineSolutionEditorIsActive()"
                   [ngbTooltip]="getInvalidSolutionTooltip()"
                   placement="right">
```

Is this ok? @vojtechjelinek

> IMAGE before: ![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63313366/221121311-2403bb3a-06ae-416b-9f41-fa74c2242c07.png) after: ![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63313366/221121348-5a0ead42-09c4-4e50-91e2-cbdeb7fc8089.png)
> 
> CODE before:
> 
> ```
> <div class="oppia-rule-header-warning-placement"
>                    *ngIf="!isSolutionValid()"
>                    (click)="toggleInlineSolutionEditorIsActive()"
>                    [ngbTooltip]="getInvalidSolutionTooltip()"
>                    placement="bottom">
> ```
> 
> after:
> 
> ```
> <div class="oppia-rule-header-warning-placement"
>                    *ngIf="!isSolutionValid()"
>                    (click)="toggleInlineSolutionEditorIsActive()"
>                    [ngbTooltip]="getInvalidSolutionTooltip()"
>                    placement="right">
> ```
> 
> Is this ok? @vojtechjelinek

+ @seanlip @Priyansh61 @SanjaySajuJacob
@sk-2809 Seems fine, we just need to make sure that this is fixed for all modals.

OK, I will take care of all modals.
Can you please assign it to me, so that I can create pull request
@vojtechjelinek I have fixed for all models, and I am creating pull request

Create an exploration with a solution that is actually not a solution (the solution answer is not correct) 2. Make the browser window less wide 3.
